title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1913.1 - Filing of estate tax returns
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 1913.1 - Filing of estate tax returns

State Regulations

Pursuant to section
972 (c)
of the Tax Law of
the State of New York, the Schenectady County Surrogate's Court hereby adopts, effective immediately, a local rule requiring the filing of a duplicate copy of
estate tax returns, statements or other documents, or copies thereof, with the

Schenectady County Surrogate's Court, when such documents are required to be
filed pursuant to section
971
of the Tax Law. This local rule shall apply to all cases
in which a petition for probate or administration is filed with the Schenectady

County Surrogate's Court. In implementing this local rule, the Schenectady

County Surrogate's Court shall apply the provisions of section
207.43
of the Uniform Rules of the

Surrogate's Court. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
1913.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
